weeklyEmail.teaser: Official email from the UT Austin Chapter of the Society of Physics Students

item.name: Open House Poster Contest Winners!
item.info:
Congratulations to the Open House Poster Contest Winners! They are:
  1. Nikita Klimovich (Using Light to Measure Heat Flow in Nanostructures)
  2. Alex Wilhelm (Rotational Energy Loss in Laser Filaments due to Molecular Rotation)
  3. Jason Koeller (Particle Dark Matter Theory: Flavor and Higgs Portal) & Luke Pharr (Irreversible buckling of PET sheets under isolated thermal loading)

item.name: SPS Movie Night!
item.info: Come hang out with fellow physicists and enjoy a movie! Bring suggestions [or a DVD if you're hanging on to pre-Netflix technology]! See you there!

item.name: Texas Physics Polo Ordering
item.info: Pre-orders start now for Texas Physics Polos (white embroidered logo on dark navy polo), brought to you by Sigma Pi Sigma. Preorders will be $25, and any extras will be sold for $30 when they arrive (add $1 for online orders and $4 for shipping). You can buy them in person from John Loftin or another SPS officer (go to RLM 5.222 - one of us is likely to be there), or online here!

item.name: Bylaws/Election
item.info:
Get out the vote! For this week, we'll first vote on the proposed changes to the bylaws (viewable here), then have elections for Vice President, Treasurer and Freshman Representative.
If you know someone who you think would be a good addition to the SPS Officers (even if that person is yourself), please nominate him or her here!

item.name: Physics Open House Pics!
item.info: Open House was a huge success! Using watermelons, we calculated little g to be 10.1+/-1.3 m/s^2! Check out pictures here!

item.name: Student-Led Spring PHY 110C Courses
item.info: (58911 filled up, but we're changing classrooms to accommodate students on the waitlist! I'm so excited! =D) It's official! The Department of Physics is offering two student-led courses next semester as PHY 110C! Unique ID 58911 (Professor Sitz) is with SPS President, Evan Ott, and LaTeX master Will Beason who will be leading an "Introduction to Data Analysis for Physics" course, geared as preparation for PHY 355L (Modern Lab / Junior Lab) with LaTeX and Mathematica. Unique ID 58913 (Professor Marder) is going to be led by Crystal Riley, on an "Introduction to Programming for Physics" using Python, geared to introduce you to concepts in programming that you can then apply in research or industry. Neither course presumes prior programming experience. For scheduling info, consult the Course Schedule, and for other questions, email us at spsofficers@gmail.com.

item.name: Mentoring Group
item.info: Mentees! Please bring a scientific article about something you are interested in and be able to explain the article for this week's meeting. If you are interested in being mentored please sign up and get your friends to sign up too! You can sign up here to be a mentee. Email SPS Webmaster, Tharon Morrison at t_morrison@utexas.edu for more information.

item.name: League of Legends Tournament!
item.info: Structure: brief introduction for the lay including strategy and general game goals, Three games: best of three, Awards: Winning Team, Crowd Favorite, Game Changing Play (all done with paper and bags to collect votes). Snacks: there will be some, optional consumption but $2 chip-in if you do

item.name: Sunday Night Study Session
item.info: It's back! Our Sunday Night Study Session (SNSS) is in full swing! For those who haven't been, every week we invite any and all physics majors and people in physics or math classes to come by to work on homework. With many upper-division students in attendance (and some LAs for classes), when you run into problems, you won't be stuck for long. We also provide cookies, coffee, tea, etc., to help keep you <s>caffeinated</s> energized. Some come by to help or be helped! If you're interested in tutoring, making known that you're available during the night (name on a chalkboard) is a great way to earn service hours for Sigma Pi Sigma.

item.name: Sigma Pi Sigma Applications Available
item.info: Applications are now available for Sigma Pi Sigma! You'll need to meet the course/GPA requirements as well as the service hour quota (see info below that has been in emails for weeks now) if you're interested. Applications are available on the 5th floor of RLM near Lisa Gentry's office, and online here. For questions, please email Sigma Pi Sigma representative John Loftin at johnloftin99@gmail.com.

item.name: Service Hours
item.info: Interested in joining Sigma Pi Sigma, the physics honors society? The requirements are listed on our website. For the service hour component, we will be managing that through the new HornsLink system (see below for the link). Join the SPS group and when you volunteer (like tutoring for SNSS above), submit a request for us to verify your service hours. That way, we have a nice record of volunteers and volunteer time (and it will show up on the resume HornsLink can create for you)! You input the time you worked, we sign off, then you don't have to think about it again!

item.name: Comments or Questions
item.info: Have something to complain about? Or a question? Maybe an idea for a meeting or event? Or suggestions about how we use technology? Contact us at spsofficers@gmail.com or see the links below! As always, Don't Forget To Be Awesome!
